member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.IReliableStateManager.BackupAsync(System.Func{Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.BackupInfo,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Performs a full backup of all reliable state managed by this .
member.param: Callback to be called when the backup folder has been created locally and is ready to be moved out of the node.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous backup operation.
member.remarks: A FULL backup will be performed with a one-hour timeout. Boolean returned by the backupCallback indicate whether the service was able to successfully move the backup folder to an external location. If false is returned, BackupAsync throws InvalidOperationException with the relevant message indicating backupCallback returned false. Also, backup will be marked as unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.IReliableStateManager.RestoreAsync(System.String)

member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous restore operation.

member.typeparam:
When specifying the type, you may ask for either a class type or an interface type.
If specifying a class type, the system will attempt to return an instance of that type. If an instance of that type cannot be instantiated (e.g., abstract class, no suitable constructor), an ArgumentException is thrown.
If specifying an interface type, the manager will attempt to resolve the interface to a concrete type. If type mapping is specified by the user, this method will use the user-specified mapping to resolve the type (not yet supported). If type mapping is not specified by the user this method will select the default implementation for the interface given. If the given interface type does not have a default implementation, or a user-specified mapping for the type is not provided or the type is invalid, this method will throw ArgumentException.
member.param: Transaction to associate this operation with.
The name of the . This name must be unique in this across types, including unrelated types.
The amount of time to wait for the operation to complete before throwing a TimeoutException. Primarily used to prevent deadlocks. The default is 4 seconds.
member.exception: is null, or is null.
An instance of the type cannot be created, or the existing instance is not of type , or is negative.
The operation failed to complete within the given timeout.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is the reliable state instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ITransaction.CommitAsync
member.summary: Commit the transaction.
member.remarks: You cannot abort a transaction once it has been committed, because all modifications have been persisted and replicated.
member.exception: The transaction has already been committed or aborted.
The transaction includes updates to state and the replica role is not Primary. Only Primary replicas are given write status.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous commit operation. The result indicates a sequence number associated with the commit operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ITransaction.Abort
member.summary: Abort (rolls back) the transaction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Collections.LockMode.Update

If false is returned, BackupAsync throws InvalidOperationException with the relevant message indicating backupCallback returned false. Also, backup will be marked as unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#Initialize(System.Fabric.StatefulServiceInitializationParameters)
member.summary: Initialize the state provider replica using the service initialization information.
member.remarks: No complex processing should be done during Initialize. Expensive or long-running initialization should be done in OpenAsync.
member.param: Service initialization information such as service name, partition id, replica id, and code package information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#OpenAsync(System.Fabric.ReplicaOpenMode,System.Fabric.IStatefulServicePartition,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Open the state provider replica for use.
member.remarks: Extended state provider initialization tasks can be started at this time.
member.param: Indicates whether this is a new or existing replica.
The partition this replica belongs to.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous open operation. The result contains the replicator responsible for replicating state between other state provider replicas in the partition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#ChangeRoleAsync(System.Fabric.ReplicaRole,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Notify the state provider replica that its role is changing, for example to Primary or Secondary.
member.param: The new replica role, such as primary or secondary.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous change role operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#CloseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gracefully close the state provider replica.
member.remarks: This generally occurs when the replica's code is being upgrade, the replica is being moved due to load balancing, or a transient fault is detected.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous close operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManager.Microsoft#ServiceFabric#Data#IStateProviderReplica#Abort
member.summary: Forcefully abort the state provider replica.
member.remarks: This generally occurs when a permanent fault is detected on the node, or when Service Fabric cannot reliably manage the replica's lifecycle due to internal failures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerConfiguration.OnDataLossEvent
member.summary: Called when the system suspects that the partition lost data. or may be used here to restore state from backup.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous operation. The boolean task result indicates whether or not state was restored, e.g. from a backup. True indicates that state was restored from an external source and false indicates that the state has not been changed.
member.remarks:
Base implementation returns false from OnDataLoss indicating that state of the replica has not been modified during OnDataLossAsync call. In other words, replica has not been restored.
If true is returned, rest of the replicas in the partition will be rebuilt by the Primary replica.
During OnDataLossAsync, replica will not have read or write status granted.

member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings
member.summary: Settings that configure the replicator

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.LoadFrom(System.Fabric.CodePackageActivationContext,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the replicator settings from a section specified in the service settings configuration file - settings.xml
member.param: Current code package activation context
Name of the configuration package
Name of the section within the configuration package xml. If empty or null, the default name("TransactionalReplicator") is presumed
member.remarks:
The following are the parameter names that should be provided in the service configuration “settings.xml”, to be recognizable by service fabric to load the transactional replicator settings.
1. BatchAcknowledgementInterval – value in seconds.
2. InitialCopyQueueSize - InitialCopyQueueSize value.
3. MaxCopyQueueSize - value.
4. MaxReplicationMessageSize - value in bytes.
5. RetryInterval - value in seconds.
6. ReplicatorAddress or ReplicatorEndpoint – should be of the form IP:Port. ReplicatorEndpoint must reference a valid service endpoint resource from the service manifest.
7. InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize - value.
8. InitialSecondaryReplicationQueueSize - value.
9. MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize - value.
10. MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize - value.
11. MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize - value in Bytes.
12. MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueMemorySize - value in Bytes.
13. OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage - value.
14. MaxMetadataSizeInKB - value in KB.
15. MaxRecordSizeInKB - value in KB.
16. MaxWriteQueueDepthInKB - value in KB.
17. SharedLogId - value.
18. SharedLogPath - value.
19. MaxWriteSizeInMB - value.
20. CheckpointThresholdInMB - value.
21. SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations - value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.RetryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets how long the Replicator waits after it transmits a message from the primary to the secondary for the secondary to acknowledge that it has received the message. The default value is 5 seconds.
member.returns: The retry interval.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.BatchAcknowledgementInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time that the replicator waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgement The default value is 50 milliseconds.
member.returns: The batch acknowledgement interval.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.ReplicatorAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the address that this replicator will use when communicating with other Replicators. The default value is "localhost:0", which picks a dynamic port number in runtime

member.returns: The max copy queue size.

member.summary: Gets or sets the max replication message size. Default value is 50MB. The unit is Bytes.
member.returns: The max replication message size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial primary replication queue size. Default value is 64. The value must be a power of 2 and the unit is 'Number of operations'
member.returns: The initial primary replication queue size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the max primary replication queue size. Default value is 1024. The value must be a power of 2 and the unit is 'Number of operations'
member.returns: The max primary replication queue size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the max primary replication queue memory size. Default value is 0, which implies there is no memory limitation. The unit is Bytes
member.returns: The max primary replication queue memory size.

member.summary: Gets or sets the GUID Identifier for the log container that is shared by a number of replicas on the windows fabric node including this one Default value is "" which causes the replicator to use the global shared log for the node.
member.returns: The shared log id.

member.summary: Gets or sets the full pathname to the log container that is shared by a number of replicas on the node including this one Default value is "" which causes the replicator to use the global shared log for the node.
member.returns: The shared log path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.DedicatedLogPath
member.summary: Gets the full pathname to the log file whose space is reserved for this replica This is a read-only value set by the transactional replicator. The dedicated log resides under the applications work directory.
member.returns: The dedicated log path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.MaxStreamSizeInMB
member.summary: Deprecated
member.returns: The max stream size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.MaxMetadataSizeInKB
member.summary: Gets or sets the Amount of extra persistent storage space reserved for the replicator specified in kilobytes that is associated with this replica. This value must be a multiple of 4. The default value is 4. The unit is KB.
member.returns: The max metadata size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.MaxRecordSizeInKB
member.summary: Gets or sets the largest record size which the replicator may write specified in kilobytes for the log that is associated with this replica. This value must be a multiple of 4 and greater than or equal to 128. The default value is 1024. The unit is KB.
member.returns: The max record size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.MaxWriteQueueDepthInKB
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum write queue depth that the core logger can use as specified in kilobytes for the log that is associated with this replica. This value is the maximum number of bytes that can be outstanding during core logger updates. It may be 0 for the core logger to compute an appropriate value or a multiple of 4. The default value is 0. The unit is KB.
member.returns: The max write queue depth.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.MaxWriteSizeInMB
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of bytes that is written to the disk in a single flush. This is to throttle the memory usage of the replicator Default value is 10. The value must be greater than 0.
member.returns: The max write size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.CheckpointThresholdInMB
member.summary: Gets or sets the checkpoint threshold. A checkpoint will be initiated when the log usage exceeds this value. Default value is 200.
member.returns: The checkpoint threshold.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.OptimizeForLocalSSD
member.summary: Deprecated
member.returns: If the OptimizeFOrLocalSSD option is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that when true indicates the log should optimize in a way where less disk space is used for the log at the cost of IO performance. If false, the log will use more disk space but have better IO performance. Default value is true.
member.returns: If the OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage option is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.ReliableStateManagerReplicatorSettings.SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that when true indicates the secondary replicator should clear the in-memory queue after acknowledging the operations to the primary (After the operations are flushed to disk) Default value is false. Settings this to "TRUE" can result in additional disk reads on the new primary, while catching up replicas after a failover
member.returns: If the SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations option is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.RestorePolicy.Safe

member.name: F:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.RestorePolicy.Force
